thread.title: Royals' Yost, Blue Jays' Gibbons have lengthy history
thread.title_full: Royals' Yost, Blue Jays' Gibbons have lengthy history

title: Royals' Yost, Blue Jays' Gibbons have lengthy history
text:
Updated: 5:09 p.m. Friday, Oct. 16, 2015 | Posted: 5:09 p.m. Friday, Oct. 16, 2015 Royals' Yost, Blue Jays' Gibbons have lengthy history Related View Larger Kansas City Royals manager Ned Yost talks to the media during a news conference before batting practice for baseball's American League Championship Series Thursday, Oct. 15, 2015 in Kansas City, Mo. The Royals will face the Toronto Blue Jays in Game 1 tomorrow. (AP Photo/Charlie Riedel) Toronto Blue Jays manager John Gibbons watches during baseball practice Thursday, Oct. 15, 2015, in Kansas City, Mo. The Toronto Blue Jays play the Kansas City Royals in Game 1 of the ALCS Friday in Kansas City. (AP Photo/Charlie Riedel) By DAVE SKRETTA The Associated Press KANSAS CITY, Mo. â€” 
The latest on the American League Championship Series between the Blue Jays and Royals, which began Friday night in Kansas City (all times local): 
4 p.m. 
Royals manager Ned Yost wishes he had listened a bit more to John Gibbons when his Toronto counterpart was on his staff a few years ago. 
Maybe he'd have learned something to help the Royals in the ALCS. 
After Gibbons was fired by the Blue Jays in 2008 in his first go-around as their manager, he was hired that October by then-Royals manager Trey Hillman as a bench coach. Gibbons stuck around when Hillman was fired in May 2010, working for Yost through the 2011 season. 
Asked about those years together, Yost acknowledged before Game 1 on Friday: "I didn't take full advantage of Gibby when he was here. At the time I was still a little on the hard-headed side and managed the game all by myself." 
Gibbons said he harbors no ill will over their time together. Copyright The Associated Press
